means: 笨拙的移动( gangle的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His gangling, awkward gait has earned him the name Spiderman.
sentence.Network_cn: 他又瘦又高，动作笨拙难看，因此有了“蜘蛛人”的外号。

sentence.Network_en: George, despite his great height and gangling walk, was a keen dancer.
sentence.Network_cn: 乔治尽管长得过高，走路姿势难看，但却热衷于跳舞。
他是一个瘦长难看的年轻人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from the verb gang + -le + -ing

entry.tran: （尤指年轻男子）瘦高而又笨拙的
entry.def: Gangling is used to describe a young person, especially a man, who is tall, thin, and clumsy in their movements.

example.ex: His gangling, awkward gait has earned him the name Spiderman.
example.tran: 他又瘦又高，动作笨拙难看，因此有了“蜘蛛人”的外号。

means.word_mean: 1. tall and thin and having long slender limbs;

sentences.sentence: "a lanky kid transformed almost overnight into a handsome young man"

auth_sentence.content: He was tall...slim, probably a trifle gangling.

auth_sentence.content: The gangling Giovanny Espinoza does his best to hold the defence together in this respect.
